lead_paragraph: The former Ohio State star Maurice Clarett and lawyers are likely to be ordered not to talk to the news media about his legal troubles because of the widespread coverage of his arrest last week, a judge in Columbus, Ohio, said yesterday. A prosecutor requested the rule of silence, accusing defense lawyers of talking to reporters too much. Judge David Fais is hearing a case in which Clarett is accused of robbing two people in January. Fais was asked to address the issue of talking to the news media after reports that the police found Clarett with four loaded guns last week.
